content: Wow, the forum is super busy this week. Eight new topics in just 3 days.
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/how-and-troubleshooting

We have a feedback on 1.15 topic open in the forum.
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/feedback-version-115
!usage
StPaulTim: https://backdropcms.org/project/usage
Hello Zulip! My first message here.

Hi, Alan Mels. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Call to undefined function ctools_export_crud_load_all
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/call-undefined-function-ctoolsexportcrudloadall
@BWPanda (Peter) ++ for cleaning up after me in the forum.
New forum post: {{ zBotz 3 }}. Feedback, assistance, comments, etc. welcome. Jump in! :smile: :heart:

Hi, ForumBot. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU

New forum post: {{ moar testz }}.
Feedback, assistance, comments, etc. welcome. Jump in! :smile: :heart:
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) Ooh, multi-lines, nice! Also, I think these should go in https://backdrop.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/218769-Forum...
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) ++ for forum post notifications in Zulip! :tada:
(serundeputy)** great work (Karma: 3)
Anyone wanting to see them should make sure you're subscribed to the Forum stream.
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) ++
(serundeputy)** (Karma: 4)
@Alan Mels - Nice to see you in the forum today! Hope your doing well.
A dissatisfied customer - https://forum.backdropcms.org/comment/2123#comment-2123

I also wrote an answer... SEO Meta Tags module does the job pretty well (as mentioned a few month ago in this thread), but without Token support. I don't see Token support here as urgent, I can't remember a project where this would have been helpful (for Views!)

@Sarvasri - Sorry, but I just discovered that you had a post in the forum caught in moderation. Our SPAM prevention tool occasionally catches a message for unknown reasons. Your next post should post immediately. Sorry that we did not catch this quicker.

Is anyone able to help with this question in the forum?
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/how-does-one-create-taxonomy-term-programmatically
See question in last comment.
I don't see a question in what I believe is the last comment: https://forum.backdropcms.org/comment/2202#comment-2202
Sorry, I misread it. Your right, the user was confirming something, not looking for confirmation.

But, here is an unanswered question that came in during Backdrop LIVE.
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/simpletest-not-running-init-hook-test-module

"I'm testing the new Backdrop release against some changes in our general system setup, and right on the very first test, it's behaving very strangely. The Actions test enables a test module, actions_loop_test, that depends on code running in its hook_init implementation......."

Someone is looking for help with CKEditor in the forum. Specifically Emoji support.
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/ckeditor-emoji-support

This question is over a week old without any answer. It's related to version 1.17 and SimpleTest. I don't think I can answer it.
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/simpletest-not-running-init-hook-test-module

I don't think I can answer it.

Neither can I. Possibly something with the simpletest profile caching? No idea.

A user in the forum has a case of the disappearing content type.
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/some-content-type-fields-disappeared

StPaulTim said:

A user in the forum has a case of the disappearing content type.
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/some-content-type-fields-disappeared

Don't have time to log into the forums. Never re-create a variable of a different type with the same name would be issue number one. There's never enough cache clearing for that one. It should also go to the config files if the fields were originally created with config.
It is now appearing that missing config files may have been the culprit.

It's been confirmed that missing config files were the culprit. It would appear that this former Drupal 7 user didn't realize that Backdrop CMS is storing config in JSON files. Is there something we can/should do to help D7 users understand this important change.

I would like to help, but it is not clear from the way that the user is describing things as to which steps exactly they may have taken, and why that broke things they way it did. What the user mentions re deleting the fields and the content still being displayed does not make sense to me (unless caching kicked in somehow) ...at some point the user mentions that the fields randomly disappeared, and then they say that it was done intentionally. They lost me :sweat_smile: :shrug:

A user is having trouble creating a menu in a custom module:
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum-topic/menu-items-not-showing?page=0%2C0#comment-2407

Thanks @StPaulTim. Asnwering that question lead me to creating this new issue: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4797

Menu items not added to main menu automatically · Issue #4797 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
People coming from Drupal are having issues with menu items in their modules not appearing in the main menu as they did in Drupal. After looking into this and reproducing the problem, I discovered ...
@BWPanda++
bwpanda kudos (Karma: 21)
Nice investigation, reply and follow-up issue @BWPanda ++
bwpanda :-) (Karma: 22)

Blimey! Another forum post results in another bug report: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4799

"Undefined index: distribution_name" for Drupal migrations · Issue #4799 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
If a Drupal site is upgraded to Backdrop then the installation doesn't run and 'distribution_name' doesn't get set. However when we get that information from the profile info file, ...

It'd be good to get some feedback on this from anyone who uses the Backdrop Forum: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/forum.backdropcms.org/issues/81

Accepted Answer issues · Issue #81 · backdrop-ops/forum.backdropcms.org
I don't like the accepted answer as it currently stands: It doesn't list any author, date, etc. info It's duplicated down with the rest of the other answers I propose the following: Upd...
